# PTD Today Monthly Intelligence Brief  
**Period:** Last 30 days  

---

## 1) Top Themes  
- Offshore wind capacity expansion and new ownership moves  
- Solar sector growth with record CfD deployment and large-scale projects  
- AI’s emerging role impacting economics and digital twins in energy  
- Grid modernization for flexible community solar integration  
- Supply chain localization mandates in battery storage  
- Security concerns around subsea cables and geopolitical risks  

---

## 2) Top Stories  
- Finnish police seized a ship for allegedly cutting a subsea cable and detained the Russian crew, highlighting infrastructure security concerns (Source: datacenterdynamics.com).  
- China maintains leadership in offshore wind turbine single-unit capacity with Vestas installing a 15 MW turbine (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- Apollo has become co-owner of the UK’s Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, indicating continued investment in large-scale offshore projects (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- The UK solar sector is projected to achieve record Contracts for Difference (CfD) deployment in 2026, signaling strong policy support (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- India mandates a domestic content requirement of 20% for battery storage projects, reinforcing local supply chain development (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- US market solar capacity forecasted to reach 737.8 GW by 2035, underlining significant growth potential (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- Tata Power Renewable completed a 1 GW Direct Content Requirement (DCR) compliant photovoltaic project for SJVN, demonstrating large-scale PV project execution (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- New digital twin technology using artificial intelligence has emerged for floating PV applications, indicating digitization trends in renewables (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- US state utility ordered to provide flexible grid connections to enable community solar, supporting distributed energy resource integration (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- AI ‘inference economics’ identified as an important trend to watch in 2026 by Plexo Capital, pointing to AI’s strategic role in power and data sectors (Source: CNBC Television).  

---

## 3) Sector Takeaways  

### Grid  
- Flexible grid connections mandated to facilitate community solar adoption in the US, promoting distributed energy integration.  
- Infrastructure security at risk as subsea cable sabotage incidents prompt law enforcement action.  

### Renewables  
- Offshore wind capacity growing with high-capacity turbine installs and major ownership changes (Vestas, China, Apollo, Hornsea 3).  
- Solar markets in UK, US, India, Bangladesh, and Nepal show strong expansion driven by policy support, domestic content mandates, and new projects.  
- Digital twin and AI adoption in floating PV systems signals increasing technology convergence.  

### Storage  
- India’s 20% domestic content rule for battery storage projects underscores growing focus on localization and supply chain resilience.  

### Data Centers & AI  
- AI advancing beyond data centers into energy sector applications such as floating PV digital twins and inference economics with implications for power and industrial sectors.  

### Chips & Supply Chain  
- Intel’s new Arizona fab under scrutiny reflecting chipmaker supply chain significance, though limited details from headline.  

### Rare Earths
